name: Delays in developmental milestones
description: Observable delays in achieving developmental milestones, such as walking or talking, compared to peers.

name: Difficulty with problem-solving and abstract thinking
description: Observable challenges in reasoning, solving problems, or grasping abstract concepts.

name: Poor academic performance compared to peers
description: Observable underachievement in educational settings relative to others of the same age group.

name: Difficulty with daily living activities
description: Observable struggles with tasks such as dressing, feeding, or hygiene that are expected for the individual’s developmental stage.

name: Delayed or impaired speech development
description: Observable delay or difficulty in producing spoken language appropriate for the individual’s age.

name: Misarticulations
description: Observable incorrect pronunciation or sound substitutions in words.

name: Difficulty maintaining a conversation
description: Observable struggles with conversational turn-taking, staying on topic, or understanding conversational norms.

name: Limited vocabulary
description: Observable restricted range of words used in speech or writing compared to peers.

name: Limited or atypical eye contact
description: Observable reduced or unusual patterns of making eye contact during social interactions.

name: Repetitive motor movements or speech patterns
description: Observable repeated behaviors, such as hand-flapping or speech patterns like echolalia.

name: Difficulty with social reciprocity
description: Observable challenges in responding to social cues or engaging in back-and-forth social interactions.

name: Insistence on sameness
description: Observable rigid adherence to routines or rituals, with distress over changes.

name: Fidgeting or inability to stay seated
description: Observable physical restlessness, such as squirming or leaving a seat when expected to remain seated.

name: Excessive talking or interrupting others
description: Observable tendency to talk excessively or interrupt conversations.

name: Difficulty paying attention to details
description: Observable inattentiveness or carelessness in completing tasks or activities.

name: Forgetfulness or losing items frequently
description: Observable habit of misplacing objects or forgetting daily responsibilities.

name: Poor reading fluency or comprehension
description: Observable struggles with reading speed, accuracy, or understanding text.

name: Difficulty with writing mechanics
description: Observable challenges with spelling, punctuation, or organizing thoughts in written form.

name: Problems with basic arithmetic operations
description: Observable struggles with addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division.

name: Poor coordination or clumsiness
description: Observable difficulties with motor tasks, such as dropping items or bumping into objects.

name: Repetitive motor behaviors
description: Observable stereotyped movements, such as rocking or hand-waving.

name: Sudden, involuntary tics
description: Observable motor movements, such as facial grimacing or repetitive blinking.

name: Recurrent motor tics
description: Observable repetitive movements, such as head jerking or shoulder shrugging.

name: Recurrent vocal tics
description: Observable repetitive sounds, such as throat clearing or grunting.

name: Hallucinations
description: Perceptual experiences without external stimuli, such as hearing voices or seeing visions. Auditory hallucinations are the most common in schizophrenia.

name: Persecutory Delusions
description: Fixed, false beliefs that involve being targeted, harmed, or persecuted, even with evidence to the contrary.

name: Grandiose Delusions
description: Fixed, false beliefs about having exceptional abilities, wealth, or fame, even when untrue.

name: Somatic Delusions
description: Fixed, false beliefs about physical health or body functions, such as being infested with parasites.

name: Erotomanic Delusions
description: Fixed, false beliefs that someone, often of higher status, is in love with the individual.

name: Loose Associations
description: Observable disorganized thinking where speech jumps between topics with little connection.

name: Tangentiality
description: Observable disorganized thinking where responses diverge from the question asked, without addressing it.

name: Word Salad
description: Observable disorganized thinking where words are incoherently mixed, making speech incomprehensible.

name: Unpredictable Agitation
description: Observable grossly disorganized motor behavior characterized by sudden, unpredictable agitation.

name: Inappropriate Emotional Responses
description: Observable grossly disorganized motor behavior, such as laughing or crying at inappropriate times.

name: Difficulty Initiating or Completing Tasks
description: Observable grossly disorganized behavior where routine tasks cannot be started or finished.

name: Catatonic Immobility
description: Catatonic behavior characterized by immobility or remaining fixed in bizarre postures.

name: Catatonic Mutism
description: Catatonic behavior marked by a complete lack of verbal response despite prompt.

name: Echolalia
description: Catatonic behavior involving repeating another person’s words.

name: Echopraxia
description: Catatonic behavior characterized by mimicking another person’s movements.

name: Affective Flattening
description: Negative symptom involving reduced emotional expression in the face, voice, or gestures.

name: Avolition
description: Negative symptom characterized by decreased motivation for purposeful activities.

name: Anhedonia
description: Negative symptom involving a loss of interest or pleasure in activities.

name: Alogia
description: Negative symptom involving reduced verbal output or poverty of speech.

name: Social Withdrawal
description: Negative symptom characterized by reduced engagement with others and avoidance of social interactions.

name: Poor Hygiene or Self-Care
description: Other observable sign involving neglect of hygiene or personal care routines.

name: Inappropriate Affect
description: Other observable sign where emotions expressed are not consistent with the context (e.g., laughing at sad news).

name: Rapid Changes in Mood
description: Other observable sign involving noticeable and rapid fluctuations in emotional state.

name: Increased Energy or Activity
description: Observable sign of mania, involving engagement in excessive goal-directed activities.

name: Inflated Self-Esteem or Grandiosity
description: Unrealistically high confidence or belief in one’s abilities, observable during manic episodes.

name: Pressured Speech
description: Rapid and continuous speech that is difficult to interrupt, commonly observed in manic episodes.

name: Flight of Ideas
description: Observable rapid and disconnected thoughts or speech, characteristic of mania.

name: Decreased Need for Sleep
description: Functioning with significantly reduced sleep without feeling tired, an observable feature of mania.

name: Risky Behaviors
description: Engaging in activities with a high likelihood of painful consequences, such as reckless spending or risky sexual behavior, often seen in mania.

name: Distractibility
description: Easily diverted by irrelevant stimuli, noticeable during conversations or activities, a sign of mania.

name: Mildly Increased Energy or Activity
description: Observable in hypomania, involving a subtle increase in goal-directed actions.

name: Subtle Inflated Self-Esteem or Confidence
description: Mildly unrealistic confidence, observable during hypomanic episodes.

name: Rapid Speech in Hypomania
description: Noticeable rapid speech that is less extreme than in full mania.

name: Psychomotor Agitation or Retardation
description: Noticeable fidgeting, restlessness, or slowed movements, commonly observed in depressive episodes.

name: Slowed Speech or Lack of Responsiveness
description: Observable during depressive episodes, involving delayed or minimal verbal interactions.

name: Changes in Weight or Appetite
description: Observable physical changes related to eating habits, such as weight gain or loss during depressive episodes.

name: Flat or Tearful Affect
description: Reduced emotional expression or tearfulness, observable in depressive episodes.

name: Rapid Mood Shifts
description: Visible rapid shifts in mood, particularly during mixed features of mania and depression.

name: Unpredictable Behaviors in Mixed Features
description: Observable behaviors such as laughing while tearful, characteristic of mixed mania and depression.

name: Flat or Blunted Affect
description: Reduced emotional expression during interactions, commonly observed in depressed mood.

name: Tearfulness or Crying
description: Frequent crying episodes, observable in individuals with depressive episodes.

name: Withdrawal from Social Interaction
description: Noticeable avoidance of friends, family, or activities, a sign of depressed mood.

name: Monotone Speech
description: Speaking with little variation in tone or enthusiasm, observed in depressed mood.

name: Slumped Posture
description: Physical indication of low energy or emotional distress, observable in depressive episodes.

name: Decreased Participation in Activities
description: Withdrawal from previously enjoyed hobbies or social events, a sign of anhedonia.

name: Reduced Responsiveness to Positive Events
description: Lack of visible joy or excitement in typically pleasurable situations, characteristic of anhedonia.

name: Psychomotor Agitation
description: Noticeable restlessness, such as pacing, hand-wringing, or fidgeting, observed in depressive episodes.

name: Psychomotor Retardation
description: Slowed movement, speech, or thought processes visible to others, a sign of depressive episodes.

name: Observable Insomnia
description: Difficulty falling or staying asleep, noted during clinical observation or self-report.

name: Excessive Daytime Fatigue
description: Observable lethargy or falling asleep during daytime activities, a sign of sleep disturbances in depression.

name: Significant Weight Loss or Gain
description: Observable changes in body weight over a short period, related to depressive episodes.

name: Observable Overeating or Undereating
description: Changes in eating patterns visible to others, common in depressive episodes.

name: Difficulty Concentrating
description: Observable distractibility during conversations or tasks, a cognitive sign of depression.

name: Indecisiveness
description: Visible struggle to make simple decisions, an observable sign of depression.

name: Frequent Sighing
description: Often observed in individuals experiencing distress or emotional pain in depression.

name: Expressions of Hopelessness or Despair
description: Statements or behaviors indicating a lack of hope for the future, observable in suicidality.

name: Giving Away Belongings
description: Observable actions that may indicate suicidal intent in depressive disorders.

name: Avoidance Behaviors
description: Avoiding feared objects, places, or situations, such as avoiding social gatherings in Social Anxiety Disorder.

name: Safety Behaviors
description: Carrying objects or engaging in rituals to reduce perceived danger, such as carrying water to prevent panic attacks.

name: Restlessness or Fidgeting
description: Observable inability to remain still, including pacing or tapping.

name: Avoidance of Eye Contact
description: Often seen in Social Anxiety Disorder, characterized by reluctance to make eye contact.

name: Rapid Breathing (Hyperventilation)
description: Frequently observed during panic attacks or high-anxiety states, characterized by rapid or shallow breathing.

name: Sweating
description: Excessive perspiration observed during feared situations or when anxious.

name: Shaking or Trembling
description: Noticeable physical trembling, often in hands, during anxiety episodes.

name: Increased Heart Rate (Tachycardia)
description: Observable chest discomfort or visible pulse changes due to anxiety.

name: Muscle Tension
description: Observable clenching of jaws, fists, or stiffness in posture associated with anxiety.

name: Flushed or Pale Skin
description: Visible changes in skin tone, such as redness or pallor, caused by anxiety.

name: Startle Response
description: Exaggerated reaction to stimuli, such as sudden loud noises, indicating heightened sensitivity.

name: Irritability
description: Observable frustration or emotional outbursts linked to anxiety.

name: Difficulty Concentrating
description: Observable distractibility during tasks or conversations due to anxiety.

name: Emotional Numbing
description: Reduced facial expressions or a flat affect, particularly when discussing emotional topics.

name: Easily Overwhelmed or Distracted
description: Observable difficulty managing multiple tasks or maintaining conversations.

name: Interpersonal Conflicts
description: Frequent arguments or strained relationships due to irritability or emotional detachment.

name: Avoidance of Close Relationships
description: Noticeable reluctance to engage in or maintain personal connections.

name: Wounds or Injuries
description: Self-inflicted harm or visible scars from repetitive behaviors, such as cutting or hitting.

name: Weight Fluctuations
description: Observable changes in weight, possibly linked to stress-induced eating habits.

name: Disorientation
description: Confusion about time, place, or personal identity that others can observe.

name: Behavioral Changes with Different Identities
description: Sudden, observable shifts in demeanor, voice, or posture consistent with different identities, as seen in Dissociative Identity Disorder.

name: Unexplained Changes in Skills or Habits
description: Observable inconsistencies in abilities, such as suddenly demonstrating skills the individual previously did not possess.

name: Amnesia-Related Behaviors
description: Observable difficulty recalling personal information, such as names, addresses, or recent events, especially during interpersonal interactions.

name: Fugue Episodes
description: Unexpected travel or wandering without clear awareness of purpose, often accompanied by confusion or inability to explain their actions.

name: Withdrawal from Social Interactions
description: Noticeable avoidance of social situations or reluctance to engage with others.

name: Flat Affect or Emotional Detachment
description: Reduced emotional expression, making it appear as though the individual is 'numb' or disconnected.

name: Difficulty Maintaining Relationships
description: Observable relational conflicts or inability to sustain connections due to inconsistencies in identity or memory.

name: Startle Response
description: Heightened physical reaction to stimuli, often out of proportion to the situation.

name: Sudden Changes in Handwriting or Mannerisms
description: Observable alterations in how an individual writes or carries themselves, particularly during identity shifts.

name: Fatigue or Exhaustion
description: Visible signs of weariness, potentially resulting from the mental strain of dissociation.

name: Blank Stares or Zoning Out
description: Periods where the individual appears unresponsive or 'lost in thought,' disrupting conversations or activities.

name: Avoidance of Certain Topics or Discussions
description: Noticeable discomfort or reluctance to engage in conversations about personal history or trauma.

name: Frequent Doctor Visits
description: A noticeable pattern of repeatedly seeking medical evaluations or second opinions, even when reassurance has been provided.

name: Excessive Health-Related Behaviors
description: Constant checking for signs of illness or exaggerated efforts to prevent health issues, such as wearing excessive protective gear or avoiding certain foods.

name: Avoidance Behaviors
description: Avoidance of work, school, or daily responsibilities due to perceived health concerns.

name: Visible Anxiety or Distress About Health
description: Observable worry or preoccupation during discussions about medical or physical health.

name: Exaggerated Presentation of Physical Complaints
description: Affected individuals may emphasize the severity of physical sensations or ailments, such as visibly wincing, limping, or grimacing.

name: Non-Specific Physical Complaints
description: Observations of individuals reporting vague or shifting complaints that are inconsistent with medical findings.

name: Somatic Focus
description: Noticeable emphasis on physical body parts or functions during interactions, often accompanied by expressions of concern.

name: Overt Expression of Frustration
description: Observable irritation or anger directed at medical professionals for perceived inadequacies in diagnosis or treatment.

name: Social Withdrawal
description: Avoidance of social situations or activities due to preoccupation with health concerns or fear of exacerbating symptoms.

name: Interpersonal Conflict
description: Observable tension with family or caregivers over the perceived legitimacy of the individual’s physical concerns.

name: Rejection of Medical Reassurance
description: Persistently expressing disbelief in medical findings, even when tests confirm no abnormalities.

name: Focused Discussions on Health
description: Frequent steering of conversations toward personal health concerns, often dominating interactions.

name: Restrictive Eating
description: Avoidance or limitation of food intake, often noticeable in eating habits or avoidance of meals in social settings.

name: Binge Eating Episodes
description: Consumption of large amounts of food in a short time, often accompanied by secrecy or shame.

name: Purging Behaviors
description: Observable efforts to eliminate food from the body, such as frequent trips to the bathroom after meals (e.g., self-induced vomiting, use of laxatives, diuretics, or enemas).

name: Excessive Exercise
description: Persistent or intense physical activity beyond normal routines, often focused on burning calories or weight control.

name: Ritualistic Eating Behaviors
description: Unusual habits like cutting food into small pieces, avoiding food touching on a plate, or chewing excessively.

name: Food Hoarding or Hiding
description: Collecting or concealing food for later consumption.

name: Noticeable Weight Changes
description: Significant weight loss, weight gain, or weight fluctuations inconsistent with normal patterns.

name: Emaciation
description: Extremely low body weight, often with visible loss of muscle mass and subcutaneous fat.

name: Swollen Glands or Cheeks
description: Physical effects of frequent vomiting, such as swelling of the salivary glands.

name: Callused Knuckles (Russell’s Sign)
description: Calluses or abrasions on the knuckles or back of the hand caused by repeated contact with teeth during self-induced vomiting.

name: Dry Skin and Hair Loss
description: Changes in physical appearance related to malnutrition.

name: Dental Erosion
description: Visible enamel loss or cavities caused by repeated exposure to stomach acid during purging.

name: Avoidance of Eating with Others
description: Refusal to eat in social situations, often with excuses like 'I already ate' or 'I’m not hungry.'

name: Preoccupation with Food or Body Image
description: Observable focus on calorie counting, weight, or body shape in conversations and behaviors.

name: Irritability or Mood Swings
description: Noticeable emotional changes, often associated with malnutrition or obsession with eating habits.

name: Social Withdrawal
description: Avoiding friends, family, or activities, especially those involving food.

name: Frequent Illness or Fatigue
description: Regular complaints of tiredness, weakness, or feeling unwell, often linked to inadequate nutrition.

name: Cold Intolerance
description: Wearing heavy clothing in warm environments due to reduced body fat and impaired temperature regulation.

name: Visible Gastrointestinal Distress
description: Observations of bloating, constipation, or discomfort associated with food intake.

name: Involuntary Urination
description: Observable episodes of urination in bed or clothing during the day or night beyond the developmental age where continence is expected.

name: Frequent Bedwetting
description: Repeated bedwetting that may occur several times a week.

name: Daytime Wetting
description: Observable instances of urination in inappropriate places, such as during school or play.

name: Avoidance of Social Activities
description: Reluctance to participate in social events, particularly sleepovers, due to fear of bedwetting.

name: Discomfort or Embarrassment
description: Visible distress or avoidance behavior following an episode of incontinence.

name: Involuntary Defecation
description: Repeated passage of feces in inappropriate places, such as clothing or the floor, beyond the age where bowel control is expected.

name: Constipation with Overflow Incontinence
description: Observable leakage of stool due to chronic constipation, often accompanied by a distended abdomen.

name: Deliberate Soiling
description: Observable episodes of defecation in inappropriate places, which may or may not be intentional.

name: Foul Odor or Soiled Clothing
description: Visible evidence of fecal matter on clothing or persistent body odor.

name: Avoidance of Toilet Use
description: Resistance to using the toilet, particularly in unfamiliar or public settings.

name: Changes in Posture or Squatting
description: Observable postures indicating attempts to hold in urine or feces.

name: Frequent Trips to the Bathroom
description: Increased frequency of bathroom use without successful elimination.

name: Emotional Distress
description: Observable frustration, embarrassment, or withdrawal following incidents of incontinence.

name: Physical Discomfort
description: Visible signs of abdominal pain or discomfort, particularly in cases of encopresis related to constipation.

name: Difficulty Initiating Sleep
description: Prolonged periods of wakefulness at bedtime, observable through complaints of 'taking hours to fall asleep.'

name: Frequent Awakenings
description: Observable restlessness or complaints of waking up multiple times during the night.

name: Daytime Fatigue
description: Observable signs of exhaustion, such as nodding off during activities or difficulty concentrating.

name: Irritability
description: Observable mood changes, such as increased agitation or frustration.

name: Excessive Daytime Sleepiness
description: Frequent episodes of falling asleep during conversations, meals, or while working.

name: Unintended Napping
description: Observable occurrences of unplanned sleep episodes during the day.

name: Difficulty Waking Up
description: Visible signs of grogginess, disorientation, or needing extended periods to fully awaken, also known as 'sleep drunkenness.'

name: Sudden Sleep Attacks
description: Episodes of falling asleep suddenly, even in inappropriate situations.

name: Cataplexy
description: Observable episodes of muscle weakness, such as sudden loss of muscle tone triggered by strong emotions like laughter or surprise.

name: Sleep Paralysis
description: Complaints or descriptions of being temporarily unable to move while waking or falling asleep.

name: Hypnagogic Hallucinations
description: Vivid, dream-like images or sensations reported during sleep transitions.

name: Loud Snoring
description: Persistent and loud snoring, often reported by a bed partner.

name: Gasping or Choking During Sleep
description: Observable pauses in breathing followed by gasping or choking.

name: Breathing Interruptions
description: Observable episodes of stopped breathing without effort during sleep.

name: Misalignment of Sleep Schedule
description: Observable patterns of going to bed and waking up at irregular or inappropriate times for work or social obligations.

name: Sleepwalking
description: Observable episodes of walking or performing other activities while still asleep.

name: Sleep Terrors
description: Sudden awakenings with screaming or intense fear, accompanied by physical signs like sweating or rapid breathing.

name: Restless Sleep
description: Observable signs of distress during sleep due to vivid and disturbing dreams.

name: Acting Out Dreams
description: Observable movements, such as flailing arms or shouting during sleep.

name: Uncontrollable Leg Movements
description: Observable fidgeting or jerking of the legs, particularly during periods of rest.

name: Frequent Position Changes
description: Persistent shifting in bed to relieve discomfort.

name: Visible Discomfort
description: Observable grimacing or complaints of 'crawling sensations' in the legs.

name: Prolonged or Absent Ejaculation
description: Delayed ejaculation during sexual activity despite adequate stimulation, observable during partnered sexual activity.

name: Observable Frustration Due to Inability to Ejaculate
description: Frustration or cessation of sexual activity due to inability to reach ejaculation.

name: Difficulty Obtaining an Erection
description: Challenges in achieving an erection during sexual activity.

name: Difficulty Maintaining an Erection
description: Challenges in sustaining an erection until the completion of sexual activity.

name: Reduced Erectile Rigidity
description: Observable reduction in erectile rigidity that interferes with penetration or satisfaction.

name: Delayed or Absent Female Orgasm
description: Significant delay, infrequency, or absence of orgasm during partnered sexual activity.

name: Reduced Intensity of Orgasmic Sensations
description: Observable reduction in the intensity of orgasmic sensations.

name: Absent or Reduced Sexual Interest
description: Noticeable lack of initiation or receptivity to sexual activity.

name: Reduced Sexual Arousal
description: Lack of lubrication or genital response during sexual activity.

name: Lack of Sexual Excitement
description: Observable absence of pleasure in response to erotic cues.

name: Tensing of Pelvic Muscles
description: Observable tensing or tightening of pelvic muscles during attempted vaginal penetration.

name: Pain or Discomfort During Intercourse
description: Observable pain or discomfort during intercourse, often leading to avoidance of sexual activity.

name: Distress During Gynecological Exams
description: Observable distress or reluctance during gynecological exams due to fear of pain.

name: Lack of Sexual Initiation
description: Observable absence of sexual activity or initiation, despite opportunities for intimacy.

name: Reduced Responsiveness to Erotic Cues
description: Lack of observable reaction to erotic stimuli or overt sexual advances.

name: Premature Ejaculation
description: Observable ejaculation occurring within approximately one minute of vaginal penetration or before desired.

name: Frustration Due to Premature Ejaculation
description: Noticeable frustration or partner dissatisfaction following early ejaculation.

name: Sexual Dysfunction from Substance Use or Medication
description: Observable impairments in sexual functioning coinciding with substance use or medication.

name: Physical Signs of Withdrawal or Intoxication
description: Observable effects such as difficulty maintaining an erection or reduced sexual arousal linked to substance use.

name: Preference for Clothing Associated with Experienced Gender
description: Observable insistence on wearing clothing stereotypically associated with the opposite gender or refusal to wear clothing typically associated with the assigned gender.

name: Cross-Gender Roles in Play
description: Observable preference for role-playing games or toys typically associated with the opposite gender, and strong rejection of toys, games, or activities stereotypically associated with the assigned gender.

name: Preference for Playmates of Experienced Gender
description: Persistent and observable preference for socializing or playing with children of the opposite gender.

name: Rejection of Assigned Gender Characteristics
description: Observable aversion to physical traits or roles associated with the assigned gender, such as avoidance of rough-and-tumble play in boys or refusal to wear dresses in girls.

name: Physical Expression of Experienced Gender
description: Observable gestures, mannerisms, or behaviors that align more closely with the experienced gender than with the assigned gender.

name: Observable Attempts to Alter Physical Appearance
description: Persistent attempts to modify appearance to align with the experienced gender, such as binding breasts, tucking genitals, or using makeup and hairstyles associated with the opposite gender.

name: Rejection of Secondary Sexual Characteristics
description: Observable distress or avoidance of situations that emphasize secondary sexual characteristics, such as avoiding tight clothing that highlights features of the assigned gender.

name: Persistent Discomfort with Assigned Gender Roles
description: Observable avoidance of activities, clothing, or situations culturally associated with the assigned gender.

name: Desire for Physical Transition
description: Observable efforts to pursue medical interventions to alter physical characteristics, such as hormone therapy or surgeries, to align with the experienced gender.

name: Social Transition Efforts
description: Observable changes in name, pronouns, or presentation to align socially with the experienced gender.

name: Frequent Temper Tantrums or Outbursts
description: Observable anger or irritability, often disproportionate to the situation, commonly associated with Oppositional Defiant Disorder (ODD).

name: Argumentative or Defiant Behavior
description: Persistent arguing with authority figures or refusal to comply with rules, frequently observed in Oppositional Defiant Disorder (ODD).

name: Deliberate Annoyance of Others
description: Observable attempts to provoke or irritate others, commonly noted in individuals with Oppositional Defiant Disorder (ODD).

name: Blaming Others for Mistakes
description: Observable deflection of responsibility onto others for one’s actions or errors, often seen in Oppositional Defiant Disorder (ODD).

name: Aggression Toward People or Animals
description: Observable behaviors such as bullying, physical fights, or cruelty to animals, commonly associated with Conduct Disorder.

name: Destruction of Property
description: Acts of vandalism or deliberate property damage, a hallmark of Conduct Disorder.

name: Deceitfulness or Theft
description: Observable lying, stealing, or manipulation to gain personal benefit, frequently seen in Conduct Disorder.

name: Serious Violations of Rules
description: Persistent truancy, running away, or breaking curfews, characteristic of Conduct Disorder.

name: Recurrent Physical or Verbal Aggression
description: Observable outbursts of aggression, such as shouting or physical altercations, commonly seen in Intermittent Explosive Disorder (IED).

name: Impulsive Behavior During Episodes
description: Observable inability to control actions during outbursts, such as breaking objects or physical harm, associated with Intermittent Explosive Disorder (IED).

name: Lack of Premeditation
description: Outbursts are spontaneous rather than planned, a feature of Intermittent Explosive Disorder (IED).

name: Deliberate Fire-Setting
description: Observable preparation and execution of setting fires with no clear motive beyond fascination, a key feature of Pyromania.

name: Fascination with Fire
description: Observable preoccupation with fire-related objects or activities, characteristic of Pyromania.

name: Repeated Theft of Items Without Need
description: Observable stealing of objects that have no personal or monetary value, a hallmark of Kleptomania.

name: Attempt to Resist Urges
description: Observable distress or attempts to refrain from stealing, often failing, associated with Kleptomania.

name: Impaired Control
description: Observable repeated attempts to cut down or stop substance use, often unsuccessful.

name: Cravings
description: Observable restlessness, irritability, or fidgeting when discussing or seeking substances.

name: Increased Tolerance
description: Observable need for larger amounts of a substance to achieve the same effect, such as noticeable escalation in use.

name: Withdrawal Symptoms
description: Observable physical effects such as sweating, tremors, agitation, or nausea when not using the substance.

name: Slurred Speech
description: Observable difficulty in articulation and coherence during conversation, often associated with alcohol-related disorders.

name: Unsteady Gait
description: Observable lack of coordination or difficulty walking, commonly noted in alcohol-related disorders.

name: Impaired Judgment
description: Observable risky behaviors such as unsafe driving or engaging in fights, often due to alcohol-related disorders.

name: Reddened Eyes
description: Observable bloodshot eyes after recent cannabis use.

name: Slowed Reaction Time
description: Observable delays in response during conversations or activities, commonly linked to cannabis use.

name: Increased Appetite
description: Observable excessive eating, commonly known as 'munchies,' following cannabis use.

name: Dilated Pupils
description: Observable enlargement of pupils during intoxication, frequently associated with stimulant-related disorders.

name: Hyperactivity
description: Observable restlessness or rapid, repetitive movements, often noted in stimulant-related disorders.

name: Increased Talkativeness
description: Observable excessive and rapid speech, commonly linked to stimulant-related disorders.

name: Paranoia or Suspicious Behavior
description: Observable distrust of others or hypervigilant actions, often linked to stimulant-related disorders.

name: Constricted Pupils
description: Observable pinpoint pupils during intoxication, frequently associated with opioid-related disorders.

name: Nodding Off
description: Observable intermittent drowsiness or falling asleep inappropriately, commonly seen in opioid-related disorders.

name: Track Marks or Scarring
description: Observable scars or marks from injection sites on the skin, associated with opioid-related disorders.

name: Drowsiness or Sedation
description: Observable lethargy or difficulty staying awake, often linked to sedative, hypnotic, or anxiolytic-related disorders.

name: Impaired Motor Coordination
description: Observable clumsiness or unsteady movements, commonly associated with sedative, hypnotic, or anxiolytic-related disorders.

name: Visual or Auditory Hallucinations
description: Observable responses to non-existent stimuli, such as talking to objects or reacting to sounds not present, linked to hallucinogen-related disorders.

name: Panic or Paranoid Behavior
description: Observable distress or hypervigilance during or after hallucinogen use.

name: Chemical Smell on Breath or Clothing
description: Observable strong chemical odors, such as glue or paint, emanating from the individual, linked to inhalant-related disorders.

name: Sores or Rash Around Mouth or Nose
description: Observable irritation or lesions near the mouth or nostrils, commonly seen in inhalant-related disorders.

name: Uncoordinated Movements
description: Observable lack of balance or difficulty walking, often associated with inhalant-related disorders.

name: Chronic Cough or Shortness of Breath
description: Observable signs of respiratory distress, commonly associated with tobacco-related disorders.

name: Stained Teeth or Fingertips
description: Observable discoloration from prolonged tobacco use.

name: Preoccupation with Gambling
description: Observable frequent discussions or focus on betting, odds, or winnings, often seen in gambling disorder.

name: Chasing Losses
description: Observable repetitive attempts to recover money lost from gambling.

name: Agitation When Unable to Gamble
description: Observable irritability or restlessness when opportunities to gamble are restricted.

name: Disorientation
description: Observable confusion about time, place, or identity.

name: Memory Impairment
description: Observable difficulty recalling recent events, personal history, or information.

name: Repetitive Behaviors
description: Observable repeated questioning, actions, or phrases due to forgetfulness.

name: Wandering
description: Observable aimless walking or leaving safe environments without reason.

name: Difficulty with Tasks
description: Observable challenges in completing everyday tasks, such as cooking, managing finances, or dressing.

name: Impaired Judgment
description: Observable poor decision-making or risky behavior, such as inappropriate financial transactions.

name: Diminished Emotional Expression
description: Observable reduction in facial expressions, gestures, or emotional reactivity.

name: Changes in Speech or Language
description: Observable trouble finding words, forming coherent sentences, or following conversations.

name: Impaired Motor Coordination
description: Observable clumsiness or difficulty with activities requiring motor skills, such as buttoning a shirt or writing.

name: Hallucinations or Delusions
description: Observable reactions to stimuli not present, such as talking to imaginary people or believing false ideas.

name: Inappropriate Social Behavior
description: Observable disregard for social norms, such as interrupting conversations or violating personal space.

name: Fluctuating Alertness
description: Observable changes in attention and awareness throughout the day, specific to delirium.

name: Restlessness or Agitation
description: Observable fidgeting, pacing, or inability to remain still, specific to delirium.

name: Lethargy
description: Observable drowsiness or reduced responsiveness, specific to delirium.

name: Profound Memory Loss
description: Observable inability to recall significant personal or public information, specific to major neurocognitive disorder.

name: Severe Impairment in Problem-Solving
description: Observable difficulty with logical reasoning or completing multi-step tasks, specific to major neurocognitive disorder.

name: Disinhibition
description: Observable impulsive or socially inappropriate behavior, specific to major neurocognitive disorder.

name: Subtle Memory Lapses
description: Observable forgetting of names, appointments, or recent events, specific to mild neurocognitive disorder.

name: Slight Difficulty with Navigation
description: Observable challenges in finding familiar locations or following directions, specific to mild neurocognitive disorder.

name: Apathy or Withdrawal
description: Observable lack of interest in activities or social interactions, specific to frontotemporal neurocognitive disorder.

name: Compulsive or Repetitive Behaviors
description: Observable stereotyped movements or rituals, such as tapping or pacing, specific to frontotemporal neurocognitive disorder.

name: Progressive Decline
description: Observable worsening of memory, language, or problem-solving over time, specific to neurocognitive disorder due to Alzheimer’s disease.

name: Misplacing Objects
description: Observable frequent placing of items in unusual locations, such as keys in the refrigerator, specific to neurocognitive disorder due to Alzheimer’s disease.

name: Physical Signs of Trauma
description: Observable injuries such as bruises or scars on the head, specific to neurocognitive disorder due to traumatic brain injury.

name: Difficulty with Coordination
description: Observable trouble walking or maintaining balance, specific to neurocognitive disorder due to traumatic brain injury.

name: Irritability or Mood Swings
description: Observable sudden emotional outbursts or changes in demeanor, specific to neurocognitive disorder due to traumatic brain injury.

name: Tremors or Motor Dysfunction
description: Observable shaking hands or jerky movements, specific to substance/medication-induced neurocognitive disorder.

name: Slurred Speech
description: Observable difficulty articulating words clearly, specific to substance/medication-induced neurocognitive disorder.

name: Sedation or Drowsiness
description: Observable lethargy or unresponsiveness, specific to substance/medication-induced neurocognitive disorder.

name: Bradykinesia
description: Observable slowness of movement, specific to neurocognitive disorder due to Parkinson’s disease.

name: Tremors
description: Observable shaking, especially in the hands or arms, specific to neurocognitive disorder due to Parkinson’s disease.

name: Facial Masking
description: Observable reduced facial expression, specific to neurocognitive disorder due to Parkinson’s disease.

name: Chorea
description: Observable involuntary, jerky movements, specific to neurocognitive disorder due to Huntington’s disease.

name: Difficulty Swallowing
description: Observable struggles with eating or drinking, specific to neurocognitive disorder due to Huntington’s disease.

name: Myoclonus
description: Observable sudden, involuntary muscle jerks, specific to prion disease.

name: Rapid Cognitive Decline
description: Observable quick deterioration in thinking and memory, specific to prion disease.

name: Ataxia
description: Observable lack of muscle coordination, specific to prion disease.

name: Impulsivity
description: Observable rash or reckless decision-making without considering consequences.

name: Manipulative Behaviors
description: Observable attempts to influence others for personal gain or control.

name: Inappropriate Anger
description: Observable frequent or intense outbursts disproportionate to the situation.

name: Detachment or Aloofness
description: Observable withdrawal or lack of engagement in social interactions.

name: Erratic Mood Swings
description: Observable rapid shifts in emotional expression.

name: Rigid Thinking or Behavior
description: Observable inflexibility in attitudes, routines, or social interactions.

name: Self-Harm or Risky Behaviors
description: Observable actions like cutting, burning, or reckless substance use.

name: Excessive Attention-Seeking
description: Observable need for admiration or constant reassurance.

name: Fear of Abandonment
description: Observable behaviors aimed at avoiding rejection or being alone.

name: Suspiciousness or Paranoia
description: Observable distrust or misinterpretation of others' motives.

name: Social or Interpersonal Conflict
description: Observable difficulty maintaining relationships due to confrontational or unpredictable behavior.

name: Grandiosity
description: Observable overestimation of one's abilities or sense of superiority.

name: Suspicion or Distrust of Others
description: Observable suspicion or distrust of others without sufficient evidence, specific to Paranoid Personality Disorder.

name: Hypervigilance
description: Observable hypervigilance or reluctance to confide in others, specific to Paranoid Personality Disorder.

name: Lack of Interest in Relationships
description: Observable lack of interest in forming relationships or engaging with others, specific to Schizoid Personality Disorder.

name: Flat Affect or Emotional Detachment
description: Observable flat affect or emotional detachment, specific to Schizoid Personality Disorder.

name: Eccentric Behavior or Appearance
description: Observable eccentric behavior or appearance, specific to Schizotypal Personality Disorder.

name: Inappropriate or Constricted Affect
description: Observable inappropriate or constricted affect, specific to Schizotypal Personality Disorder.

name: Difficulty Maintaining Close Relationships
description: Observable difficulty maintaining close relationships, specific to Schizotypal Personality Disorder.

name: Disregard for Others' Rights
description: Observable disregard for others' rights, such as lying or conning, specific to Antisocial Personality Disorder.

name: Aggression or Irresponsibility
description: Observable aggression or irresponsibility in social or occupational settings, specific to Antisocial Personality Disorder.

name: Unstable Relationships
description: Observable unstable relationships, often alternating between idealization and devaluation, specific to Borderline Personality Disorder.

name: Self-Harming Behaviors
description: Observable self-harming behaviors or gestures, specific to Borderline Personality Disorder.

name: Dramatic or Exaggerated Emotional Expressions
description: Observable dramatic or exaggerated emotional expressions, specific to Histrionic Personality Disorder.

name: Use of Physical Appearance to Draw Attention
description: Observable use of physical appearance to draw attention, specific to Histrionic Personality Disorder.

name: Arrogance or Entitlement
description: Observable arrogance or entitlement in interactions, specific to Narcissistic Personality Disorder.

name: Lack of Empathy
description: Observable lack of empathy in interpersonal relationships, specific to Narcissistic Personality Disorder.

name: Reluctance to Engage in Social Activities
description: Observable reluctance to engage in social activities due to fear of criticism, specific to Avoidant Personality Disorder.

name: Avoidance of Interpersonal Contact
description: Observable avoidance of interpersonal contact despite a desire for connection, specific to Avoidant Personality Disorder.

name: Submissive or Clinging Behavior
description: Observable submissive or clinging behavior to avoid abandonment, specific to Dependent Personality Disorder.

name: Difficulty Making Independent Decisions
description: Observable difficulty making independent decisions, specific to Dependent Personality Disorder.

name: Perfectionism Interfering with Task Completion
description: Observable perfectionism interfering with task completion, specific to Obsessive-Compulsive Personality Disorder.

name: Preoccupation with Rules or Orderliness
description: Observable preoccupation with rules, orderliness, or control, specific to Obsessive-Compulsive Personality Disorder.

name: Compulsive Engagement in Specific Activities
description: Observable repetitive or ritualistic behaviors linked to atypical sexual interests.

name: Difficulty Controlling Impulses
description: Observable failure to resist urges or behaviors despite negative consequences.

name: Violation of Social or Legal Norms
description: Observable actions that breach social, moral, or legal boundaries (e.g., voyeurism or exhibitionism).

name: Distress or Impairment
description: Observable avoidance of situations or activities due to distress about sexual urges or interests.

name: Risky or Harmful Behaviors
description: Observable engagement in activities that could endanger oneself or others (e.g., exposing oneself or coercing others).

name: Persistent Preoccupation with Specific Interests
description: Observable distractions or inability to focus on daily tasks due to fixation on atypical sexual interests.

name: Exposing Genitals to Unsuspecting Individuals
description: Observable exposing of genitals to unsuspecting individuals, specific to Exhibitionistic Disorder.

name: Inappropriate or Public Sexual Acts
description: Observable inappropriate or public sexual acts intended to shock or gain attention, specific to Exhibitionistic Disorder.

name: Fixation on Non-Living Objects or Body Parts
description: Observable fixation on non-living objects or body parts (e.g., shoes, feet), specific to Fetishistic Disorder.

name: Distress or Difficulty Engaging in Typical Sexual Activities
description: Observable distress or difficulty engaging in typical sexual activities without the fetishized item, specific to Fetishistic Disorder.

name: Touching or Rubbing Against Non-Consenting Individuals
description: Observable attempts to touch or rub against non-consenting individuals in crowded spaces, specific to Frotteuristic Disorder.

name: Physical Proximity to Unsuspecting Individuals for Arousal
description: Observable behaviors involving physical proximity to unsuspecting individuals for arousal, specific to Frotteuristic Disorder.

name: Inappropriate Attention or Behaviors Directed Toward Minors
description: Observable inappropriate attention or behaviors directed toward minors, specific to Pedophilic Disorder.

name: Engagement in Activities with Minors
description: Observable engagement in activities or seeking opportunities to be alone with children, specific to Pedophilic Disorder.

name: Seeking Situations Involving Humiliation or Pain
description: Observable seeking of situations involving humiliation, pain, or suffering for sexual arousal, specific to Sexual Masochism Disorder.

name: Physical Marks or Injuries Indicative of Self-Inflicted Harm
description: Observable physical marks or injuries indicative of self-inflicted harm, specific to Sexual Masochism Disorder.

name: Inflicting Pain or Humiliation on Others
description: Observable infliction of pain or humiliation on others for sexual gratification, specific to Sexual Sadism Disorder.

name: Coercion or Manipulation of Others
description: Observable efforts to coerce or manipulate others into participating in harmful activities, specific to Sexual Sadism Disorder.

name: Distress or Compulsive Behaviors Related to Cross-Dressing
description: Observable distress or compulsive behaviors related to cross-dressing, specific to Transvestic Disorder.

name: Preoccupation with Clothing Items Traditionally Associated with Another Gender
description: Observable preoccupation with clothing items traditionally associated with another gender, specific to Transvestic Disorder.

name: Secretly Watching Others Engaged in Private Activities
description: Observable attempts to secretly watch others engaged in private activities, such as undressing or sexual acts, specific to Voyeuristic Disorder.

name: Use of Tools or Strategies to Facilitate Surveillance
description: Observable use of tools or strategies to facilitate surveillance (e.g., binoculars, cameras), specific to Voyeuristic Disorder.

name: Unusual or Atypical Behaviors
description: Observable actions or behaviors that deviate significantly from social norms or expectations.

name: Cognitive Impairments
description: Observable confusion, memory difficulties, or disorganized thinking not attributable to a neurocognitive disorder.

name: Affective Instability
description: Observable emotional fluctuations or inappropriate emotional responses.

name: Behavioral Changes
description: Observable shifts in daily routines, social interactions, or self-care behaviors.

name: Psychomotor Abnormalities
description: Observable slowed or agitated movements, not explained by other mental or medical conditions.

name: Unexplained Distress or Functional Impairment
description: Observable challenges in social, academic, or occupational functioning without clear diagnostic criteria from other categories.

name: Tardive Dyskinesia
description: Involuntary, repetitive movements of the face, tongue, lips, or limbs. Examples include lip-smacking, grimacing, or rapid blinking.

name: Parkinsonism
description: Observable tremors (resting tremors), rigidity or stiffness in the muscles, bradykinesia (slowed movements), and postural instability (difficulty maintaining balance).

name: Akathisia
description: Observable restlessness, such as pacing, shifting weight, or inability to stay still.

name: Acute Dystonia
description: Sudden, sustained muscle contractions causing twisting or abnormal postures. Examples include neck twisting (torticollis) or upward eye movement (oculogyric crisis).

name: Neuroleptic Malignant Syndrome
description: Severe muscle rigidity, autonomic instability (e.g., fluctuating blood pressure, rapid heart rate), and elevated body temperature (fever).

name: Medication-Induced Postural Tremor
description: Rhythmic, involuntary shaking of the hands, head, or other body parts, particularly when maintaining a posture.

name: Tardive Dystonia and Tardive Akathisia
description: Persistent dystonia or akathisia developing after prolonged medication use.

name: Other Dyskinesias
description: Observable jerking, writhing, or slow movements affecting various muscle groups.
